I have a crawler that has stopped crawling even though there are plenty 
for things for it to crawl.  A jstack showed 1190 of these errors.

java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)  at 
sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)

JEEvictor" daemon prio=10 tid=0x00002ab870f28800 nid=0x2180 waiting on 
condition [0x00002ab882272000]
    java.lang.Thread.State: TIMED_WAITING (parking)
         at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
         - parking to wait for  <0x00002aab34ca0998> (a 
java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject)
         at 
java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.parkNanos(LockSupport.java:198)
         at 
java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject.awaitNanos(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:1963)
         at 
java.util.concurrent.ArrayBlockingQueue.poll(ArrayBlockingQueue.java:342)
         at 
java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.getTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:945)
         at 
java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:907)
         at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:619)



A quick search showed this could be a bug with Java older than 6u21, 
although someone else reported that upgrading to build 1.6.0_27-b07 did 
not solve their problem.

I am using:

java version "1.6.0_16"
Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.6.0_16-b01)

Can anyone recommend a version of java that could fix this problem? 
Update 30?  Has anyone usedJava 7uX to run Heritrix?

--David
